summary: This is a sworn statement from a security consultant detailing his professional background, his security work for Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 until her arrest, the security threats she faced, and the events surrounding her arrest on July 2, 2020. The consultant also states his company will post a $1 million bond for her bail application.

persons.name: Security Consultant
persons.context: The author of the affidavit. He details his 25-year UK military and special forces background, his security work for the Maxwell family, and his provision of security services for Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 until her arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary subject of the security consultant's protection. The document details the security protocols for her, the threats she faced, and the events of her arrest on July 2, 2020. The consultant's company is posting a bond for her bail.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the reason Ghislaine Maxwell received death threats connected to her relationship with him some 20 years previously.

persons.name: Princess Diana
persons.context: Cited as an example of a life lost due to press intrusion, used to justify the need for meticulous security planning for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: The Security Consultant was contracted to provide close protection and security services for Ghislaine Maxwell from approximately July 2019 until her arrest.
The document states Maxwell received death threats connected to her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein from some 20 years previously.
The Security Consultant states he has provided security consultation and services for the Maxwell family for a number of years in both the UK and US.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein Announced
events.description: The announcement of Jeffrey Epstein's death. The Security Consultant's risk assessment after this date showed Ghislaine Maxwell was at substantial risk.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: FBI agents arrested Ghislaine Maxwell at a residence in Bradford, New Hampshire. Her security operative reported a helicopter and vehicles approaching, initially assumed to be press, before federal agents identified themselves.

events.title: Affidavit Signed
events.description: The Security Consultant signed this sworn statement in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application.

keyFacts: A security consultant with UK Special Forces background provided protection for Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 until her arrest in July 2020.
Ghislaine Maxwell faced death threats connected to her past relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and aggressive harassment from the press.
Her arrest on July 2, 2020, in Bradford, New Hampshire, was executed by FBI agents who approached the property, initially mistaken for press by her security.
A security protocol was in place for Maxwell to move to a locked safe room with supplies if her security was threatened.

The security consultant's company agreed to post a $1 million bond for Maxwell's bail application, a first for the consultant, based on their relationship and the proposed strict confinement conditions.
